model_solution:
To compute the determinant of the given 3x3 matrix, we will use the formula for the determinant of a 3x3 matrix, which is:

\[ \begin{vmatrix} a & b & c \\ d & e & f \\ g & h & i \end{vmatrix} = a(ei - fh) - b(di - fg) + c(dh - eg) \]

In this case, a = 2, b = 0, c = -1, d = 7, e = 4, f = -3, g = 2, h = 2, and i = 5.

So, the first step is to plug these values into the formula:

\[ \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 0 & -1 \\ 7 & 4 & -3 \\ 2 & 2 & 5 \end{vmatrix} = 2(4*5 - (-3)*2) - 0(7*5 - (-3)*2) + (-1)(7*2 - 4*2) \]

Now we will simplify the expression inside the parentheses for the next step.
To simplify the expression, we will first calculate the products inside the parentheses:

\[ \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 0 & -1 \\ 7 & 4 & -3 \\ 2 & 2 & 5 \end{vmatrix} = 2(20 - (-6)) - 0(35 - (-6)) + (-1)(14 - 8) \]

\[ \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 0 & -1 \\ 7 & 4 & -3 \\ 2 & 2 & 5 \end{vmatrix} = 2(20 + 6) - 0(35 + 6) + (-1)(14 - 8) \]

\[ \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 0 & -1 \\ 7 & 4 & -3 \\ 2 & 2 & 5 \end{vmatrix} = 2(26) - 0(41) + (-1)(6) \]

Now we will simplify further:
